I love Junk Jack, I‚Äôve been playing it since I was young. I had just recently switched to iPhone X and a new iCloud account, so I had bought junk jack again. Sad to say that when I loaded junk jack, made my character, and saw the GUI I was heartbroken. The GUI is not yet set up for iPhone X and possibly never will. Devs, please, for the Junk Jack community, bring some life into the game once more, with support for the iPhone X series.

Download at your own risk. The game is fun I‚Äôm the off chance that it works properly, but majority of the time the app just crashes. Rather you auto save or manually save, you‚Äôll still lose a good chunk of whatever you collected. It used to be a stress reliever, but now it only induces stress. Maybe an update will fix the issue, but as of right now maintain your sanity and do not download this.

Update: to add insult to injury the dev or team is completely unresponsive.

title.label: Look, I could have rated this five.

I was playing the game, and I had to log off. However, I came back the next day to find that my game data had been deleted.
This is a fun game, but not when your data is deleted.
Rest in piece, Venomous Sting.

The design of everything in this game is beautiful, not leaving me disappointed with any planet. The soundtrack fits perfectly with the planet it is made for (Albeit, Mykon and Tor could use their own). After a while, however, the building and exploration get repetitive. The bosses are quite easy to kill as well.

All in all, I would recommend this game if you are looking for a quick fix to boredom, but not if you are looking for a long term replacement for another game.

title.label: Played for 3 and a half years!

content.label:
I‚Äôve seen this game evolve and accumulate more and more planets over the years. I‚Äôve followed the dev blog, registered to the forum, and was even a beta tester in late 2015. I‚Äôm a part of the small, yet friendly, community!
I used to play MCPE around 2012‚Äì2014 and I can say JJ is simply MADE FOR mobile! It has unique, yet simple controls: swipe to walk, jump, dash, climb, and swim).

It has a cool concept, too: mine underground (starting on Terra, of course) and eventually spot a blue glow in the distance, which turns out to be a Portal Chest. Find 3 and build a portal to a planet, repeat.
All the planets have their own theme: Earth, Egyptian, exotic, alien, lava, icy, tribal, moon, beach, spore, dark/castle.
There‚Äôs so much variety in the enemies, critters, blocks, objects, plants, drops, armor, weapons, and more!
Also, each planet (except 2) has 3 unique biomes underground, each with its own ‚Äúset‚Äù of armor and weapons and you collect ‚Äúreagents,‚Äù dropped from mobs, plants, etc. to make potions with effects like defense, attack bonus, resistance, speed, luck (higher chance for more rares), making you bigger/smaller, tinting your player a certain color, and more!
You also find rare treasures‚Äîusually references to movies, games, etc.‚Äîwith no other purpose than just to trade with others online. And there‚Äôs a friendly community of traders and shopkeepers out there (BEWARE of griefers, though! There‚Äôs always griefers in games like this, no matter what!)
There‚Äôs even a ‚ÄúCollections‚Äù menu showing how many blocks, pets, treasures, food, armor, etc. you‚Äôve found, so collecting is definitely a HUGE part of the game!

TL;DR:  It‚Äôs a complex‚Äîyet simple‚Äîgame with lots to do, find, collect, and build. If you like games with lots of items to collect and a variety of unique monsters, the $5 this game costs will yield a game well worth more than twice as much!

This is really an awesome game. It works for the touch screen amazingly well. If you have a smaller screen I'd say it's the best choice out of the whole MC/ Terraria/ Junk Jack debate. This one was made for mobile though so it's understandable why it feels so fluid. I own them all and I can attest. It's great for people with fat fingers lol. It has fantastic pixel art, it's fun, and it's difficult at times when un prepared. As a long time player (played since the original jj and back when this one was called Junk Jack x) I highly suggest this game to anyone who likes crafting/survival/building/exploration/pixel art games. This is a great additive to the genre. It's held a permanent spot on my phone for a while now. Get it, you won't regret it!

Im only rating 1 star so people can see this. but ill actually rate5. so basically everyone is not happy about the new update and some people say that you cant do this or dont make multiplayer that. or this made this worse. its not worse you just have to get used to the fact that every game updates and eventually changes dramatically. SO STOP WHINING AND PLAY ITS UR FAULT YOU SPENT 5$ YOU WANTED THE GAME SO PLAY IT

After revisiting this game after a few years, I've found that the game is now better.

Gameplay - This game is like a mix of Minecraft and Terraria. It has the freedom to do anything, exploring underground, and finding treasure, and going to other planets. While it's doesn't have a great combat system or 3D, the graphics are quite good for pixel graphics. Also, the amount of loot in this game is high.

Performance - The game ran well on my iPad Air. It was smooth and didn't feel slow. Unless you have a old device, it will probably run well.

Price - While the price of the game can be a bit high, especially if you buy the IAP's, but it's definitely worth it if you end up liking the game as you can spend dozens of hours on 1 world. Also, the IAP's are permanent and are one time purchases. No IAP's are required or anything for the game, and all of it is optional.

I love this game and stuff but it reset my stuff and it was hard for me to get back at that point and when I join this one world someone killed me and took my stuff when multiplayer drop on death is off and he used a bomb item to do it so need to fix that glitch plz

title.label: Something's off about this game now

content.label:
This used to be one of my top 10 favorite games. 
  Ever since they decided to put it on multiple platforms, I have not enjoyed it. There are quite a few frame rate drops and I don't like the feel of how the character moves now. 
  It is just all around not a very smooth experience like it used to be.
  Unless it starts playing like it used to, I'm done.

title.label: I lost all the special hats I bought.

content.label: It's been a long while since I played this, but when I re-downloaded it on my new phone and I opened it I saw that all my stuff reset. I tried to see if I could restore my purchases but I realized that it was in vain. I had bought the Ninja Hat, the Carpenter Hat, and the Robin Hood hat. I also had all the planets unlocked for some reason. I'm okay with restarting but those hats I bought are lost. I'm giving three stars because it is a good game but I lost all my purchases after the reset.
